newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Nippecraft's Malaysian unit raises capital.
newsitem.headline: Nippecraft's Malaysian unit raises capital.

text.p: Stationery maker Nippecraft said on Wednesday its Malaysian unit Jinmei Industrial Sdn Bhd had increased its authorised share capital to 5.0 million ringgit from 1.0 million ringgit.
It said in a statement Jinmei also raised its issued and paid-up capital from 972,140 ringgit to 3.27 million ringgit.
This was done by the allotment and issue of an additional 2.3 million ordinary shares of one ringgit each to the company for cash at par.
The increase in capital was to bring Jenmei's working capital requirements in line with its level of business, Nippecraft said.
The company has moved most of its labour-intensive operations to Jenmei, which now produces organisers, diaries, calendars, stationery and other related products.
